discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
location: Outside Fort St. John, BC - Brownfield
description: Denali was responsible for the redevelopment of an existing 100MMSCFD sour gas facility to handle new producer gas volumes. Scope included new refrigeration unit, heat medium, 3.6MW total of generators, bullet storage, truck unloading and upgraded sweetening system packages as well as several utility systems upgrades. From the electrical side, Denali was responsible for the power generation integration plan, medium voltage development plan, and controls system development plan. Denali prepared a total installed cost estimate and evaluation including numerous engineering documents for the proposed brownfield facility improvements.

Mechanical design of power plant that produces 1.8MW of local grid power by using a combination of LNG and diesel for fuel. Evaluated numerous options for configurations and fuel usage to aid with end users economic evaluations. Created specifications and equipment RFP packages for 3 genset packages and other associated equipment.  Genset packages include jacket water heat recovery system to optimize energy efficiency within the power plant.

discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Procurement
description: Denali evaluated the feasibility of installing power generation for the client at 6 of its sites to isolate from the utility grid to reduce operating costs. This included an evaluation of existing and future loads, selection of technology (turbine vs. reciprocating generators) preliminary block flow diagrams and Class 4 estimates for each site to evaluate economics of the proposed facilities. The sites ranged from 1 to 6 MW of required power production.

discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation
description: Denali coordinated FEED engineering and regulatory support on behalf of their client for a greenfield marine terminal. Terminal products were LPG, Methanol and Clean Petroleum Products which are brought in by rail, stored, and pumped to ships on a new marine jetty/loading dock. The refrigerated LPG storage tank volume was 90,000m3 while the 18 total Methanol and Clean Petroleum Product tanks ranged from 30,000 to 40,000m3 in volume.

Denali was responsible for the mechanical design for the replacement of an 800 kW diesel engine at an existing power plant providing power for the local municipality. Reviewed feasibility of the replacement, as well as created construction drawings to integrate the new engine with the existing on-site utilities and generator.
